title: Support gpg2 smartcard integration (yubikey)
body: Don't see a way at present to use a yubikey/smartcard inside WLS. Seems like this would require USB support in order to integrate directly. Only workaround at present is to SSH into WSL and forward the ssh key, which makes the ssh-agent available to WSL, but still not the gpg-agent.

comments.body: Has this request been obsoleted by the following request for libusb?

More and more businesses & governments are moving to smartcard hard tokens like Yubikey, RSA. Fortinet, etc. Federal Information Processing Standard Publication 201 (FIPS 201) requires that access to many government systems be protected by hard tokens. Large companies are also requiring a similar level of strong IAM to access systems, push code, etc.

There is another workaround. Although it's a paid one (for commercial use) and comes with a few security implications (if you allow SSH access into the WSL machine anyone can pull in any smartcards plugged into the system)
